candidates.body:
Bumps [tokio](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio) from 1.44.1 to 1.44.2.
Release notes

Sourced from tokio's releases.

Tokio v1.44.2

This release fixes a soundness issue in the broadcast channel. The channel accepts values that are Send but !Sync. Previously, the channel called clone() on these values without synchronizing. This release fixes the channel by synchronizing calls to .clone() (Thanks Austin Bonander for finding and reporting the issue).

Fixed

  • sync: synchronize clone() call in broadcast channel (#7232)

#7232: tokio-rs/tokio#7232

candidates.title: Upgrade `contracts-verifiable` image + Implement new address derivation
Upgrade to `polkadot-sdk` commit `4a400dc1866f11707331fb6408df1055d0f42a70 `
candidates.body:
What this PR does:
* Sync with `polkadot-sdk/4a400dc1866f11707331fb6408df1055d0f42a70`
* Remove contract-specific events (`CodeStored`, `Instantiated`, etc.), as they were removed in `pallet-revive`.
* Derive address of deployed contract in `cargo-contract` instead of fetching it from an event (no longer possible).
* Some leftovers: Remove the generic `Hash` where `pallet-revive` uses a fixed `H256`.
* Remove `debug_message`, as it was removed in `pallet-revive`. We'll add the possibility to trace extrinsics in a follow-up, that's the `pallet-revive` debug functionality which replaces `debug_message`.

Follow-ups:
* Display `CodeInfoOf` for `cargo contract upload` and `cargo contract info` (if not already).
* Add a flag `--trace` to all sub-commands that issue extrinsics.
* Add `cargo contract map/unmap`.

candidates.title: Release v5.0.3
candidates.body:
### Added
- Deny overflowing (and lossy) integer type cast operations - [#1895](https://github.com/use-ink/cargo-contract/pull/1895)

### Fixed
- Use latest ink! release version in new contract template - [#1896](https://github.com/use-ink/cargo-contract/pull/1896)

candidates.title: Target `pallet-revive`/PolkaVM instead of `pallet-contracts`/Wasm
candidates.body:
This PR moves `cargo-contract` from compiling contracts to WebAssembly for Substrate's `pallet-contracts` module to compiling contracts to [PolkaVM](https://github.com/paritytech/polkavm) for Substrate's [`pallet-revive`](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/tree/master/substrate/frame/revive) module.  

It's a big breaking change. With this PR we are moving towards the next major release of both ink! and `cargo-contract` (version 6). From v6 on these tools which will no longer support Wasm/`pallet-contracts`. 

### Compatibility

The PR uses the version of `polkadot-sdk` (so also `pallet-revive`) from commit `645878a27115db52e5d63115699b4bbb89034067`. 

It works with ink! `master` (which at the time of writing is [this commit](https://github.com/use-ink/ink/commits/master/)) and [this](https://github.com/use-ink/substrate-contracts-node/commit/fad777f53ba2fcf8a90646a5c516015c63ad24be) version of `substrate-contracts-node`:

```bash
cargo install --force --git https://github.com/use-ink/substrate-contracts-node.git --rev fad777f53ba2fcf8a90646a5c516015c63ad24be
```

### Next Steps

The PR doesn't leave the code in a perfect state, there are still a lot of todo's in the code. I've disabled some individual tests for now, as they require more work. I'm merging the PR to have a base to work off and synchronize work with others.

The PR contains a lot of breaking changes that will eventually be documented in more verbatim form in the release notes and [this migration guide](https://use.ink/6.x/faq/migrating-from-ink-5-to-6/).

I'll remove the Wasm stuff from `cargo-contract` as a follow-up. I'll also remove the `revive` feature from `ink` as a follow-up.

chosen_pr.title: Bump tokio from 1.44.1 to 1.44.2

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

chosen_pr.body:
Bumps [tokio](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio) from 1.44.1 to 1.44.2.
Release notes

Sourced from tokio's releases.

Tokio v1.44.2

This release fixes a soundness issue in the broadcast channel. The channel accepts values that are Send but !Sync. Previously, the channel called clone() on these values without synchronizing. This release fixes the channel by synchronizing calls to .clone() (Thanks Austin Bonander for finding and reporting the issue).

Fixed

  • sync: synchronize clone() call in broadcast channel (#7232)

#7232: tokio-rs/tokio#7232
